Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style, possibly patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; exterior: reserved band at top of foot, glazed streaky black (fired in part brown) below; underside: trace of white slip; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros. The number 769 is written in pencil on the underside of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 171, no. 58)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1053) (phase 2)
